entry.title: Why Django Unchained makes me laugh
entry.content:
It can’t be the romance. It’s above Twilight, but not quite The Moor of Venice. It can’t be the historical value. I might not be an expert on the years prior the Civil War, but I do consider myself reasonably educated, and certainly enough to appreciate the more obvious inaccuracies. It can’t be the suspense, of course. This is a grand tale, a Tarantino, where The Good Guys Win, and of that little is left to doubt.

If it’s not either of these, then what, exactly, can it be which excited me so that I, not once nor twice but thrice, almost stood up and really did laugh out loud at the screen and with such a grin, what is it then which delighted me so?

I attribute it to three things, because three is the magic number; beyond that you’ll lose patience and your attention will waver, and beneath your thirst won’t be quenched. The first thing is art, the second is art, and the third? the third is music.
